content.text: Describe fully the single transformation that maps triangle \(T\) onto triangle \(P\)
Translate triangle \(T\) by the vector \(\left(\begin{matrix} - 2\\ - 5 \end{matrix}\right)\)
Rotate triangle \(T\) through \(90^{\circ}\) anticlockwise about (0, 0)
Enlarge triangle \(T\) by scale factor \(- \frac{1}{2}\) with centre (0, 0)
Find the column vector \(\overrightarrow{AB}\)
\[\overrightarrow{AB} = \left( \begin{array}{c} \\ \\ \end{array} \right) \quad [1]\]
Find \(\left|\overrightarrow{AB}\right|\)
\(B\) is the mid-point of the line \(AC\)
Find the co-ordinates of \(C\)
Find the equation of the straight line that passes through \(A\) and \(B\)
The straight line that passes through \(A\) and \(B\) cuts the \(y\)-axis at \(D\)
Write down the co-ordinates of \(D\)
Show that the number of boys is 115
One day, there are 15 girls absent and 15 boys absent
Find the ratio girls : boys in school on this day
Give your answer in its simplest form
Next year, the number of students will increase by \(15\%\)
Calculate the number of students next year
Since the school was opened, the number of students has increased by \(60\%\)
There are now 240 students
Calculate the number of students when the school was opened
A school has 240 students
The ratio girls : boys \(= 25:23\)
The population of a city is increasing exponentially at a rate of \(2\%\) each year
The population now is 256 000
Calculate the population after 30 years
Give your answer correct to the nearest thousand
A bacteria population increases exponentially at a rate of \(r\%\) each day
After 32 days, the population has increased by \(309\%\)
Find the value of \(r\)
Calculate the curved surface area of the cone
[The curved surface area, \(A\) , of a cone with radius \(r\) and slant height \(l\) is \(A = \pi r l\) .]
Calculate the volume of the cone
[The volume, \(V,\) of a cone with radius \(r\) and height \(h\) is \(V = \frac{1}{3}\pi r^2 h.\) ]
The cone is made of wood and \(1\mathrm{cm}^3\) of the wood has a mass of \(0.8\mathrm{g}\)
Calculate the mass of the cone
The cone is placed in a box
The total mass of the cone and the box is \(1.2\mathrm{kg}\)
Calculate the mass of the box
Give your answer in grams
The diagram shows a solid cone
The radius is \(8\mathrm{cm}\) and the slant height is \(17\mathrm{cm}\)
Find the volume of the sphere as a fraction of the volume of the cylinder
Give your answer in its lowest terms
[The volume, \(V\), of a sphere with radius \(r\) is \(V = \frac{4}{3}\pi r^3\) .]
The surface area of the sphere is \(81\pi \mathrm{cm}^2\)
Find the curved surface area of the cylinder
Give your answer in terms of \(\pi\)
[The surface area, \(A\) , of a sphere with radius \(r\) is \(A = 4\pi r^2\) .]
The diagram shows a solid cylinder and a solid sphere
The cylinder has radius \(3r\) and height \(8r\)
The sphere has radius \(r\)
Complete the table for \(\mathrm{f}(x)\)
The graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) for \(-6 \leqslant x \leqslant -0.5\) is drawn on the grid
On the same grid, draw the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) for \(0.5 \leqslant x \leqslant 6\)
By drawing a suitable tangent, estimate the gradient of the graph of \(y = \mathrm{f}(x)\) at the point \((- 4, 5)\)
\(\mathrm{g}(x) = \frac{9}{x}\) , \(x \neq 0\)
Complete the table for \(\mathrm{g}(x)\)
On the same grid, draw the graph of \(y = \mathrm{g}(x)\) for \(-4 \leqslant x \leqslant -1\) and \(1 \leqslant x \leqslant 4\)
Use your graphs to find the value of \(x\) when \(\mathrm{f}(x) = \mathrm{g}(x)\)
Write down an inequality to show the **positive** values of \(x\) for which \(\mathrm{f}(x) > \mathrm{g}(x)\)
The exact answer to **part (f)(i)** is \(\sqrt[3]{k}\)
Use algebra to find the value of \(k\)
Calculate an estimate of the mean
.........tonnes
On the grid, draw a histogram to show the information in the table
A factory recycles metal
The mass, \(x\) tonnes, of metal is measured each week
The table shows the results for 52 weeks
For how many days was the mass measured?
Find an estimate of the median
.........tonnes
Find an estimate of the upper quartile
.........tonnes
Find an estimate of the interquartile range
.........tonnes
Find an estimate of the number of days when the mass was greater than 20 tonnes
Another factory also recycles metal
The mass, \(x\) tonnes, of metal is measured each day for a number of days
The cumulative frequency diagram shows the results
Calculate angle \(ACB.\)
Calculate angle \(ACD.\)
Calculate the area of the quadrilateral \(ABCD\)
Show that a black ball is more likely to be taken from bag \(A\) than from bag \(B\)
Find the probability that the two balls have different colours
A ball is taken at random from each bag
they are all black,
they are all white
The balls are returned to their original bags
Three balls are taken at random from bag \(A\), without replacement
Find the probability that
The balls are returned to their original bags
A ball is taken at random from bag \(A\) and its colour is recorded
This ball is then placed in bag \(B\)
A ball is then taken at random from bag \(B\)
Find the probability that the ball taken from bag \(B\) has a different colour to the ball taken from bag \(A\)
Bag \(A\) contains 3 black balls and 2 white balls
Bag \(B\) contains 1 black ball and 3 white balls
Use similar triangles to calculate \(DX.\)
Calculate angle \(XAB.\)
In the diagram, \(AB\) and \(CD\) are parallel
\(AD\) and \(BC\) intersect at right angles at the point \(X\)
\(AB = 10 \text{cm},\) \(CD = 5 \text{cm},\) \(AX = 8 \text{cm}\) and \(BX = 6 \text{cm}.\)
\(P, Q, R, S\) and \(T\) lie on the circle, centre \(O\)
Angle \(PST = 75^{\circ}\) and angle \(QTS = 85^{\circ}\)
Find the values of \(v, w, x\) and \(y\)
Two containers are mathematically similar
The surface area of the larger container is \(226 \text{cm}^2\) and the surface area of the smaller container is \(94 \text{cm}^2\)
The volume of the larger container is \(680 \text{cm}^3\)
Find the volume of the smaller container
Find \(\mathrm{g}\big(\frac{1}{2}\big)\)
Find \(\mathrm{fh}(-1)\)
Find \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x)\)
Find \(\mathrm{ff}(x)\) in its simplest form
Find \(\left(\mathrm{f}(x)\right)^{2}\) in the form \(ax^{2} + bx + c\)
Find \(x\) when \(\mathrm{h}^{-1}(x) = \mathrm{g}(2)\)
Find the next term and the \(n\)th term of this sequence
Next term = .........
nth term = .........
Find the \(n\)th term of each sequence
